00:00:00:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:00:160000.Dialogue: Okay, Raj. Hand me the #6 Torx screwdriver.

00:00:07:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:07:040000.Dialogue: Stop. We can't do this. It's not right.

00:00:11:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:11:210000.Dialogue: You have two choices. Either you let him put a bigger hard drive in the TiVo, or you delete stuff before we go out of town.

00:00:17:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:17:040000.Dialogue: But once you open the box, you've voided the warranty.

00:00:20:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:20:100000.Dialogue: The warranty is a sacred covenant we've entered into with the manufacturer. He offers to stand by his equipment, and we in return agree not to violate the integrity of the internal hardware. This little orange sticker is all that stands between us and anarchy.

00:00:36:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:36:150000.Dialogue: Then we won't touch the hard drive. We'll just erase the first season of Battlestar.

00:00:46:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:46:210000.Dialogue: Is this going to be big enough?

00:00:52:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:52:220000.Dialogue: For taking daffodils to your unicorn.

00:00:57:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:57:100000.Dialogue: It's just for my notebooks. Thanks, Penny.

00:00:59:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:59:140000.Dialogue: I love San Francisco. I wish I was going with you.

00:01:02:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:02:100000.Dialogue: I understand your envy. This is a can't-miss symposium. There are going to be discussions on bioorganic cellular computer devices, the advancements in multi-threaded task completion, plus a roundtable on the nonequilibrium Green's function approach to the photoionization process in atoms.

00:01:19:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:19:130000.Dialogue: When I go, I usually just get hammered and ride the cable cars.

00:01:23:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:23:100000.Dialogue: This conference is kind of a big thing. The keynote address is being delivered by George Smoot.

00:01:28:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:28:040000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, the George Smoot?

00:01:34:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:34:060000.Dialogue: George Smoot is a Nobel Prize-winning physicist, one of the great minds of our time. His work in black body form and anisotropy of the cosmic microwave background radiation cemented our understanding of the origin of the universe.

00:01:47:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:47:110000.Dialogue: It's kind of a funny name, though. Smoot.

00:01:54:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:54:050000.Dialogue: It's like talking to a chimp.

00:01:57:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:57:140000.Dialogue: Now that I've been completely insulted, have a good flight. I wish.

00:02:01:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:01:220000.Dialogue: We're not flying. We're taking the train.

00:02:11:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:11:070000.Dialogue: - Then why are you doing it?

00:02:19:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:19:230000.Dialogue: Don't say it like that. Say it like:

00:02:51:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:51:020000.Dialogue: We're all going over to the Apple store to make fun of the guys at the Genius Bar. You want to come?

00:02:56:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:56:110000.Dialogue: I always enjoy that, but I'm a little busy.

00:03:00:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:00:130000.Dialogue: I'm simplifying the task of packing for our trip. See, by attaching RFID tags to my clothing, it will enable my laptop

00:03:07:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:07:010000.Dialogue: to read and identify the items with this wand. I will then cross-reference them against destination, anticipated activity spectrum, weather conditions, duration of trip, et cetera.

00:03:23:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:23:080000.Dialogue: How long is this going to take?

00:03:24:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:24:220000.Dialogue: Assuming I can keep up this pace, three hours, 11 minutes. Plus however long it takes to conclude this fairly pointless conversation.

00:03:34:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:34:010000.Dialogue: Teasing the guys at the Apple store seems a little redundant now.

00:03:53:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:53:120000.Dialogue: Socks: one pair, cotton, argyle, blue.

00:04:03:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:03:030000.Dialogue: What on earth are you doing?

00:04:05:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:05:150000.Dialogue: Whatever it is, I'm guessing we're doing it wrong.

00:04:08:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:08:140000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, this is the Coast Starlight, one of the great American trains operating on one of the classic American routes. On this side, you'll see panoramic ocean vistas inaccessible to any other form of transportation,

00:04:23:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:23:050000.Dialogue: while on your side, you'll be treated to 350 miles of CostCos, Jiffy Lubes, and cinderblock homes with above-ground pools.

00:04:39:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:39:130000.Dialogue: - That's over the wheelbase. Are you completely unfamiliar with the suspension characteristics of a pre-1980 Pullman-built Superliner Deluxe passenger coach?

00:04:49:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:49:210000.Dialogue: We've been on this train 90 seconds, and you've already said a thousand words.

00:04:54:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:54:020000.Dialogue: Just tell us where to sit and shut up.

00:05:00:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:00:130000.Dialogue: I'm hoping once you reap the endorphic rewards of the steady clickety-clack of steel wheels on polished rails, - your sour disposition will abate.

00:05:06:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:06:140000.Dialogue: - Yeah, maybe. Meanwhile, back in the 21st century, people are raising their tray tables and putting their seat-backs in an upright position 'cause it's time to land in San Francisco.

00:05:18:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:18:140000.Dialogue: It's not so bad, really. At least these trains have modern plumbing. In India, you squat over a hole in the train and expose your naked buttocks to the chilly air of Rajasthan.

00:05:28:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:28:050000.Dialogue: He is referring, of course, to third class on Indian Railways' magnificent Ranakpur Express and its 1,200-kilometer journey from Maharashtra to the Bikaner Junction.

00:05:38:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:38:010000.Dialogue: Oh, look, now he's boring on an international scale.

00:05:46:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:46:170000.Dialogue: - It can't be. What would Summer Glau be doing riding the train?

00:05:51:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:51:200000.Dialogue: Maybe John Connor's aboard and she's protecting him from an evil Terminator.

00:06:01:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:01:120000.Dialogue: Of course, if SkyNet actually did exist in the future, a perfect way to infiltrate and destroy mankind would be to send Terminators back posing as actors who have played Terminators in popular films and television series, lulling us into a false sense of security, i.e., That's Summer Glau from The Sarah Connor Chronicles. No, Summer, don't kill me! I'm pro-robot!

00:06:22:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:22:210000.Dialogue: At least he's off the train crap.

00:06:30:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:30:020000.Dialogue: I owe you an apology. Taking the train was a stroke of brilliance! I've actually got a shot at a Terminator.

00:06:36:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:36:050000.Dialogue: Please. When it comes to Terminators, you've got a better shot of scoring with Arnold Schwarzenegger.

00:06:42:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:42:180000.Dialogue: You're overlooking something. I have 11 hours with her in a confined space.

00:06:49:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:49:100000.Dialogue: Unless she's willing to jump off a moving train, tuck and roll down the side of a hill, she will eventually succumb to the acquired taste that is Howard Wolowitz.

00:07:02:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:02:210000.Dialogue: My money's on tuck and roll.

00:07:05:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:05:150000.Dialogue: I'm confused. I thought you were involved in some sort of socially intimate pairing with Leslie Winkle.

00:07:21:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:21:170000.Dialogue: Hang on a sec. Why do you get first crack at her?

00:07:24:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:24:140000.Dialogue: Let's see, couple reasons. - One, I saw her first.

00:07:29:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:29:230000.Dialogue: Fair enough. But... then, let me move on to #2. Unlike you, I can actually talk to women when I'm sober.

00:07:36:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:36:120000.Dialogue: You fail to take into account that even mute, I am foreign and exotic, while you, on the other hand, are frail and pasty.

00:07:45:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:45:230000.Dialogue: You know the old saying, Pasty and frail never fail.

00:07:54:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:54:010000.Dialogue: Excuse me, but what about me? Why don't I get a shot?

00:07:57:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:57:130000.Dialogue: Fine, go ahead. Take a shot.

00:08:02:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:02:070000.Dialogue: I've already got a gorgeous blonde back home that I can't score with. I think I'll let you two take this one.

00:08:07:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:07:110000.Dialogue: Is there a place on this train to get alcohol?

00:08:09:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:09:230000.Dialogue: Interesting that you ask. The Coast Starlight recently added the refurbished Pacific Parlour Car. Built in 1956 and originally known as the Santa Fe Lounge Car, the lower level is a theater and the upper level is a bar that offers wine tastings if you're going as far as Portland.

00:08:25:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:25:150000.Dialogue: - So aren't you going to go talk to her?

00:08:29:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:29:220000.Dialogue: She's probably heard every possible line. Why don't you just try hello?

00:08:33:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:33:170000.Dialogue: No, no, that always creeps girls out.

00:08:36:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:36:190000.Dialogue: I need to come up with something that's funny, smart and delicately suggests that my sexual endowment is disproportionate to my physical stature.

00:08:46:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:46:120000.Dialogue: You're going to need more than 11 hours.

00:08:54:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:54:190000.Dialogue: So we have to go back.

00:08:56:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:56:170000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm going to say why and your answer cannot be because I forgot my flash drive.

00:09:03:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:03:080000.Dialogue: You don't understand. My flash drive has my paper on astrophysical probes of M-theory effects in the early universe that I was going to give to George Smoot at the conference.

00:09:12:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:12:010000.Dialogue: Why do you have to give your paper to George Smoot?

00:09:15:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:15:050000.Dialogue: It's brilliant. He needs to read it.

00:09:18:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:18:200000.Dialogue: So you'll send him an e-mail when we get back.

00:09:21:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:21:150000.Dialogue: Then I won't get to see his face light up as he reads it.

00:09:27:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:27:180000.Dialogue: There's nothing you can do about it, so relax. Sit back, enjoy the clickety-clack of the steel wheels on the polished rails.

00:09:39:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:39:080000.Dialogue: You forgot your flash drive, you forgot your flash drive...

00:09:46:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:46:190000.Dialogue: Only ten hours, 55 minutes to go.

00:09:59:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:59:210000.Dialogue: It's hot in here. Must be Summer.

00:10:18:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:18:110000.Dialogue: Okay, I've found the perfect solution. We get off the train at the next stop in Oxnard. We then take the 1:13 train back to Union Station. We take a cab back to the apartment, get my flash drive, and then race to San Luis Obispo, where, assuming the lights are with us and minimal traffic, we'll meet the train.

00:10:38:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:38:120000.Dialogue: You take all the fun out of it for me.

00:10:41:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:41:150000.Dialogue: Penny's home. Why don't we call her, have her go in the apartment, get your flash drive and e-mail you the paper?

00:10:46:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:46:190000.Dialogue: But the flash drive is in a locked drawer in my desk.

00:10:57:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:57:060000.Dialogue: I see. It seems once again, you're caught between a rock and a crazy place.

00:11:08:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:08:080000.Dialogue: It's hot in here. Must be Summer. It's hot in here. Must be Summer.

00:11:13:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:13:200000.Dialogue: It's hot in here. Must be Summer.

00:11:26:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:26:140000.Dialogue: It's loosely based on my life.

00:11:32:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:11:32:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:32:060000.Dialogue: We're putting the play on for one night in this little 99-seat theater. Can you come? Oh, great. Do you know 98 other people that might want to come?

00:11:41:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:11:41:080000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:43:130000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:11:43:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:43:130000.Dialogue: Listen carefully. I'm about to give you a set of instructions which you must follow to the letter.

00:11:48:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:11:48:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:48:060000.Dialogue: Just a sec. The theater is above a bowling alley, so it's a little noisy, but it might be the only chance I'll ever get to play Anne Frank.

00:11:57:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:11:57:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:57:070000.Dialogue: And the director is brilliant. He uses the bowling sounds as, like, Nazi artillery.

00:12:02:110000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:02:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:02:110000.Dialogue: Great, I'll see you then. - Hello?

00:12:04:140000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:04:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:08:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:08:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:08:010000.Dialogue: Do you see that small plastic case on my dresser?

00:12:11:130000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:11:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:13:210000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:13:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:16:100000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:16:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:16:100000.Dialogue: - I'm not in San Francisco. I'm on a train. Were you even listening to me?

00:12:21:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:21:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:21:230000.Dialogue: I was talking to my friend, but what's up?

00:12:24:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:24:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:24:010000.Dialogue: What's up? I'll tell you what's up. I'm in a crisis situation, and I need you to marshal your powers of concentration, limited as they may be...

00:12:31:110000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:31:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:34:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:34:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:40:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:40:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:40:030000.Dialogue: He's calling to ask you a favor. You might be confused because he didn't use the words, Penny, Sheldon, please or favor.

00:12:48:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:12:48:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:48:040000.Dialogue: Enough chitchat. Okay, step one. Locate your emergency key to our apartment. Step two: enter our apartment. Step three:... Enter my bedroom.

00:13:00:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:00:150000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:04:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:04:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:04:230000.Dialogue: Let me tell you. Personal robots cannot get here soon enough.

00:13:11:190000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:11:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:11:190000.Dialogue: And that bright little star peeking her head out early today... that's Venus.

00:13:17:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:17:230000.Speaker: Summer
00:13:17:230000.Dialogue: That is so cool. - You really know a lot about space.

00:13:20:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:20:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:20:010000.Dialogue: - Come on. When you were on TV in Firefly, you were actually in space.

00:13:28:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:28:080000.Speaker: Summer
00:13:28:080000.Dialogue: You're not one of those guys who really believe that, are you?

00:13:31:050000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:31:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:31:050000.Dialogue: You mean one of the hopeless geeks?

00:13:34:140000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:34:140000.Speaker: Raj

00:13:39:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:39:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:39:040000.Dialogue: Howard, be a dear and get me another one of these.

00:13:47:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:47:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:47:160000.Dialogue: Now, him, he's one of those geeks.

00:13:52:000000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:13:52:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:52:000000.Dialogue: All right, now, before you enter my bedroom unescorted, I need you to understand that this onetime grant of access does not create a permanent easement.

00:14:01:180000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:01:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:04:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:04:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:04:160000.Dialogue: It's a legal right of access. Good grief.

00:14:09:120000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:09:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:09:120000.Dialogue: What? No, don't put me on hold.

00:14:14:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:14:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:14:150000.Dialogue: Do you believe him? Normally around women, he has the personality of a boiled potato. Put one beer in him, and he's M. Night Charmalarmalon.

00:14:27:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:27:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:27:170000.Dialogue: Is that what he's drinking? It's not even real beer.

00:14:30:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:30:060000.Speaker: Howard

00:14:32:050000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:32:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:36:000000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:36:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:36:000000.Dialogue: - I don't know. Some sort of placebo effect, I guess.

00:14:41:100000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:41:100000.Speaker: Howard

00:14:46:050000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:46:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:46:050000.Dialogue: Yes, I'm still here. Where am I going? I'm on a train. Now, what you'll be looking for is a small wooden box located between a Hoberman's sphere and a sample of quartz flecked with pyrite.

00:14:57:180000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:14:57:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:57:180000.Dialogue: Hoberman's Sphere. It's a collapsible icosidodecahedron.

00:15:03:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:03:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:03:150000.Dialogue: No, the thing with the time on it is my alarm clock.

00:15:09:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:09:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:09:170000.Dialogue: Actually, in India, the names of constellations are different. Where you have the Big Dipper, we have the Big Curry Pot.

00:15:18:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:18:160000.Speaker: Summer

00:15:20:090000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:20:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:20:090000.Dialogue: You got me. Now what are you going to do with me?

00:15:29:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:29:230000.Speaker: Howard

00:15:30:220000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:30:220000.Speaker: Howard

00:15:33:120000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:33:120000.Speaker: Raj

00:15:43:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:43:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:43:170000.Dialogue: Hi. I'm the small package good things come in.

00:15:50:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:50:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:50:160000.Dialogue: I got a box, but there's no key in here. Just letters.

00:15:54:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:54:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:54:070000.Dialogue: That's the wrong box. Put it back.

00:15:56:190000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:56:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:56:190000.Dialogue: Are these letters from your grandmother?

00:15:59:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:15:59:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:00:200000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:00:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:00:200000.Dialogue: Look, she calls you Moon Pie. That is so cute.

00:16:03:210000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:03:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:09:050000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:09:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:11:100000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:11:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:14:220000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:14:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:14:220000.Dialogue: I don't know what you're doing but there are little bubbles forming on the corners of Sheldon's mouth.

00:16:20:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:20:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:20:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, I kind of crossed a line. Put him back on.

00:16:22:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:22:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:25:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:25:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:28:180000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:28:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:28:180000.Dialogue: No one calls me Moon Pie but Meemaw!

00:16:33:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:33:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:37:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:37:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:37:170000.Dialogue: In the dream, you and I were ice skating, just the two of us. And then, I picked you up by your ankles and twirled you round and round until your legs tore off.

00:16:50:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:50:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:50:040000.Dialogue: I tried to stick them back on, but before I could, you turned into a giant loaf of pumpernickel bread.

00:16:58:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:16:58:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:58:160000.Dialogue: What do you think that means?

00:17:01:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:01:160000.Speaker: Summer

00:17:05:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:05:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:05:030000.Dialogue: I'll give you a clue. My favorite sandwich? Salami on pumpernickel.

00:17:10:220000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:10:220000.Speaker: Summer

00:17:13:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:13:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:13:040000.Dialogue: Did you know pumpernickel comes from the German words pumper and nickel, which loosely translates to fart goblin?

00:17:22:140000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:22:140000.Speaker: Summer

00:17:27:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:27:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:27:040000.Dialogue: Okay, I found the box. Now what?

00:17:29:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:29:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:29:040000.Dialogue: You're holding a Japanese puzzle box, which takes ten precise moves to open.

00:17:35:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:35:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:35:040000.Dialogue: First, locate the panel with the diamond pattern and slide the center portion one millimeter to the left. Then, on the opposite end of the box, slide the entire panel down two millimeters. You'll hear a slight click.

00:17:49:140000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:49:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:49:140000.Dialogue: Hang on. Do you have any emotional attachment to this box?

00:17:53:100000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:53:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:53:100000.Dialogue: No, it's a novelty I ordered off the Internet. Did you hear the click?

00:17:56:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:17:56:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:02:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:02:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:07:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:07:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:07:080000.Dialogue: Okay, here's another one. If you married the famous rock guitarist Johnny Winter, you'd be Summer Winter.

00:18:19:200000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:19:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:19:200000.Dialogue: I'm going to just go for broke here and say I like you.

00:18:26:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:26:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:26:150000.Dialogue: So here's my question: do you realistically see any conversational path that would take us from where we are right now to a place where I could ask you out and you'd say yes?

00:18:40:130000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:40:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:40:130000.Dialogue: Fair enough. I'll leave you in peace.

00:18:42:220000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:42:220000.Speaker: Summer

00:18:47:000000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:47:000000.Speaker: Howard

00:18:49:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:49:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:49:230000.Dialogue: would you mind if I take one picture of us together for my Facebook page?

00:18:54:200000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:18:54:200000.Speaker: Summer

00:19:06:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:19:06:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:06:060000.Dialogue: Great. Now, can I take one where it looks like we're making out?

00:19:12:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:19:12:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:12:020000.Dialogue: Now you're going to insert the flash drive into the USB port... She calls me Moon Pie because I'm nummy-nummy and she could just eat me up.

00:19:27:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:19:27:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:27:150000.Dialogue: Now, please put the flash drive in the USB port. The one that looks like a little duck's mouth.

00:19:38:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:19:38:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:19:40:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:19:40:060000.Speaker: Howard

00:19:48:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:19:48:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:48:060000.Dialogue: Excuse me. I'll be honest with you. I've just spent the last two hours imaging various scenarios in my head, trying to come up with some clever line to say to you. But I finally realized you're a human being; I'm a human being. - I could just say...

00:20:02:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:20:02:160000.Speaker: Announcer

00:20:04:210000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:20:04:210000.Speaker: Summer

00:20:09:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny is on the phone.
00:20:09:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:14:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:14:190000.Dialogue: So, I'm thinking, you won the Nobel Prize what, three years ago? So you must deal with a whole lot of What has Smoot done lately?

00:20:23:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:23:090000.Dialogue: My thought is we continue my research as a team... you know, Cooper-Smoot, alphabetical...

00:20:29:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:29:220000.Dialogue: and when we win the Nobel Prize, you'll be back on top.

00:20:33:170000.Speaker: George Smoot
00:20:33:170000.Dialogue: With all due respect, Dr. Cooper, are you on crack?
